description: Learned borrowing from Old English manbōt (“fine paid to the lord of a slain man or vassal”). More at man, bote.

entries.meaning: (law, historical, Anglo-Saxon) A sum paid to a lord as a pecuniary compensation for killing his vassal, servant, or tenant.
examples: If a man was slain a special manbot, or compensation for the loss of a man, had to be paid to the lord side by side with the mægbot to the kin.
